posts.post_content: There's something else that most people seem to be forgetting- that his +4 is **+4**. That, in addition to the fact that he starts with 6 loyalty, makes him the hardest planeswalker to deal with. Even tougher than [Nicol Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nicol Bolas), and playable in any color deck. I wouldn't say broken, but he's pretty close.

posts.post_content:
I sincerely believe his mechanic is the way to show him as one of the most anciet/devastating planeswalker in game, and storyline.
  
   
Consider the fact he ensures you and your opponents that nothing is safe from him, that he can wreck your opponents plans (hand), crack their field (permanents), and if all else fails which he doent like, he pushes the restart button to your advantge.
  
   
Of course, th cost is high for him to do so, but as long as the option is there, the possibility of you controlling the battlefield to your advantage is assured, just don't be careless.
  
   
Hell, even the Eldrazi brothers would be useless if they got out late only to be removed, either by hand or more luckily, on the field.
posts.html:

Consider the fact he ensures you and your opponents that nothing is safe from him, that he can wreck your opponents plans (hand), crack their field (permanents), and if all else fails which he doent like, he pushes the restart button to your advantge.

Of course, th cost is high for him to do so, but as long as the option is there, the possibility of you controlling the battlefield to your advantage is assured, just don't be careless.

Hell, even the Eldrazi brothers would be useless if they got out late only to be removed, either by hand or more luckily, on the field.

Posted By: Tori_Rofocale (8/23/2011 12:42:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Karn is an suitably epic planeswalker, and ever since [Ghostfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostfire) (which happens to look fantastic in Knights vs. Dragons) I've been interested in colorless stuff. The frames always look awesome, and they make sense because the only way to represent it is with *nothing*. All the colorless Eldrazi spells look amazing, and the tokens too.  
Things like [Steel Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Hellkite) fascinate me too, the white glow in its mouth and the colorless firebreathing ability. Cards such as that and [All is Dust](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=All is Dust) represent pure, massive power and that's really cool.  
Anyone who's ever seen a spirit token from Champions knows how much of a shame it is ):  
I guess I just like the aesthetics of things  
4.5/5
posts.html:

Things like Steel Hellkite fascinate me too, the white glow in its mouth and the colorless firebreathing ability. Cards such as that and All is Dust represent pure, massive power and that's really cool.
